moves.1. h4: edge of board opening not too advisable
moves.2. h5: pushing a pawn not certain of his intentions
moves.2... h6: blocked the advance of the pawn
moves.5. f3: getting ready for a center pawn push, in order to gain center control
moves.8. fxe4: he captured my e5 pawn allowing me to capture his pawn and gain a pawn advantage
moves.11... Bxf3 12. Qc1: instead of retreating his queen he could have played Be7 leading to a capture of a piece
moves.12... Qh4+: a check out of nowhere that i perceived to be my best move
moves.13. Rf2: he blocked the check in the only way he could
moves.15. Rxf3 Qh4+: back with another check sensing a promising continuation
moves.16. Rg3 O-O-O: an offensive castle best way to bring my rook into the action
moves.17. c4 Qh2: setting the stage for a check with high hopes
